summary: Web encompasses the digital landscape and its evolution. It explores the fragmentation of the internet, comparing it to geological processes, and discusses ecosystem architecture as a way to view digital landscapes as complex systems. The concept embraces diversity and innovation in the face of a changing online world. It also advocates for keeping the web weird by engaging in internet advocacy, embracing open-source principles, exploring digital fabrication, and championing digital ownership. This approach fosters creativity, preserves internet freedom, and promotes a diverse, user-driven ecosystem that resists uniformity and corporate control.
excerpt: The internet has fragmented like tectonic shifts, and attempts to reunify it are futile. Ecosystem architecture views this as an opportunity, embracing diversity in digital landscapes. The article explores types of fragmentation, historical context, and stakeholder perspectives.
